usage_summary: Say what someone/something is (job, identity, state).
deep_grammar: Copula agrees with person; 3rd person is often implicit/fused.
Georgian uses postpositions/case endings to encode location relations.

usage_summary: Say someone/something is from a place.
deep_grammar: -დან marks source/origin with places; stems may change before suffixing.
-გან is used for human source/sender, distinct from place -დან.

usage_summary: Describe how (well/badly) or transformation (became X / elected as X).
deep_grammar: Adverbial case (-ad) creates adverbs from adjectives and marks state changes.

usage_summary: Negate statements across frames (incl. reinforced negatives).
deep_grammar: Negation placement patterns + double negatives (nothing/nowhere).
Often minimal structural change; intonation/particles do the work.
WH forms interact with role (e.g., 'who' changes based on function).

usage_summary: Say you/they are going somewhere now.
deep_grammar: Directional motion encoded in verb family; destination marking interacts with postpositions.
Contrasts with 'going' for deictic direction; same destination-marking logic.

usage_summary: Say you/they are coming/going from somewhere/someone.
deep_grammar: Source marking composes with motion verbs; extremely reusable.

usage_summary: Say you’re going/coming in order to do something.
deep_grammar: Purpose phrases behave like goals; key bridge into clause-building.
Experiencer-style alignment (inversion family); agreement lives in the verb.
Same inversion spine as 'want/like'; very high-frequency.
Animacy split (different ‘have’ verb) with same experiencer logic.
'Pleasing-to' style verb family; same alignment family as want/have.

usage_summary: Say what you prefer / choose between options.
deep_grammar: Preference often triggers explicit comparisons; bridges to comparison operators.
Existentials are a separate core clause type from copula identity.

usage_summary: Do an activity with no direct object (work, sleep, live).
deep_grammar: Establishes ‘plain subject+verb’ baseline.
Core transitive template; sets up the past-series alignment shift later.
Introduces a second human participant slot cleanly.
Optional but powerful: verbs can encode beneficiary/recipient morphology.

usage_summary: Say how you do something (with a knife, by bus, using X).
deep_grammar: Instrumental case (-it) is obligatory for non-human means. Distinct from 'with a person'.

usage_summary: Talk about 'doing' an action (start working, love swimming).
deep_grammar: Georgian prefers Masdars (nominalized verbs) over infinitives; usually takes Genitive case.
Modal-as-state patterns; complements want/need.
Core necessity operator; interacts strongly with subjunctive/irrealis later.

usage_summary: Systematically learn present forms for a model verb.
deep_grammar: Paradigm anchor: person/number agreement becomes automatic.

usage_summary: Systematically learn future forms for the same model verb.
deep_grammar: Preverbs often participate; prevents ‘I can’t form future’ gap.

usage_summary: Systematically learn completed past and the alignment shift.
deep_grammar: This is split ergativity territory; must be explicit and drilled.

usage_summary: Systematically learn ‘was doing / used to do’.
deep_grammar: Gives narrative background and aspect intuition.
Preverbs are the ‘GPS’; same root, different preverb ⇒ different meaning.
Preverbs are a main aspect engine, not only spatial.
Perfect encodes ‘result now’ / ‘apparently’; key for natural storytelling.
Useful for sequencing events; stabilizes tense control.
Prevents ‘I can only say it in present’ plateau for inversion verbs.
Same idea: make future productive, not memorized.
Imperatives are their own morphology; isolate to avoid confusion with statements.

usage_summary: Tell someone not to do something.
deep_grammar: Negated commands behave differently than plain negation.

usage_summary: Cover ‘that I do / so that I do / if I were to…’.
deep_grammar: This is the engine behind planning, goals, and many connectors.
Enough to avoid being blocked by hypotheticals.
Core algebra for longer speech early.
Pick 1–2 connectors and drill hard; huge mileage.
Forces tense/mood choices; accelerates screeve intuition.

usage_summary: Express purpose (‘so that / in order to’).
deep_grammar: Strongly interacts with subjunctive/irrealis.

usage_summary: Say ‘I think that… / he said that…’.
deep_grammar: Backbone for complex speech; unlocks narrative/argument.
-ზე doubles as ‘on’ and ‘than’ in comparisons; high leverage.
